Books for 2014

By Aung 🥷🏻
Posted 2014-02-24 1 min read

These days,people stop reading books. Technology plays a great role in that. It changes lifestyle of people, including me. It’ve been a while I stop reading actual books such as fictions, non-fictions and novels. I spent more time reading on ‘information live for a short term period’ stuffs. Sources like twitter, RSS reader and news curated media changes the way I read.

Now, I decided to change my reading habit back to old-fashioned style. Back to committed reading!! I selected to read at least 1 books per month.(Not included comics and graphic novels.)

2014 Selected Books

  1. I’ll Go Home Then, It’s Warm and Has Chairs. The Unpublished Emails. by David Thorne
  2. This is a book by Martin, Demetri
  3. iWoz by Steve Wozniak and Gina Smith
  4. Physics of the Impossible: A Scientific Exploration into the World of Phasers, Force Fields, Teleportation, and Time Travel by Kaku, Michio
  5. Geektastic:Stories from the Nerd Herd by Holly Black
  6. Googled: The End of the World As We Know It by Ken Auletta
  7. Metamorphosis by Franz Kafka
  8. Flush: A Biography by Virginia Woolf
  9. The Circle by Dave Eggers
  10. Squirrel Seeks Chipmunk by David Sedaris
  11. Let’s Explore Diabetes with Owls by David Sedaris
  12. Dad Is Fat by Jim Gaffigan

Setup

  • Platform: Readmill & Playbooks
  • Format: ePub
  • Devices: Samgsung Galaxy SII & Kindle Fire
  • Location: Coffee shop,Couch, Bed,Bus-Stop and other random places
  • Time: unknown variable
Book, Yearly
Book Review
